file_content.text: You have done enough. Go.
You don't belong here. You stand before the Chamber of the Dark Council, and this floor is off-limits to all who are not Lords of the Sith.
If you are not on official business, you will leave now.
I've come with news about your son.
I must tell you something.
Wow, this looks like a nice place to hang out all day. How do I land your job?
Nice gig you've got.
You kill more people than you ever knew were alive, and when you are done, you... I sense... you are carrying my son's remains?
Or what?
You are either insane or merely a fool. I suggest you leave.
Please, I'm sorry. I have word of your son.
Wait, let's try again.
So that is the smell you carry. It is said he went into the tomb of Naga Sadow to prove himself and was killed.
Right. See, but I... have this body....
I don't know how to put this.
Right. See, but I... have this body....
I don't know how to put this.
Right, I see, but, uh, I have this body....
I don't know how to put this.
I see. Those are the remains of my son.
He was such a weak boy. He shames me in death as he shamed me in life.
When I heard of his death, I could not leave my post; honor forbade it. Still, I would like to know what happened in there.
Of course. Ask away, my lord.
Yes, sir.
Your deference does you credit.
Tell me what happens around here, first. Must be pretty crazy.
You share, then I will.
Tell me about what happens around here, first. Must be pretty crazy.
You share, then I will.
Tell me about what happens around here, first. Must be pretty crazy.
You share, then I will.
This is where the Dark Council meets, where Sith politics play out, where the Emperor issues his decrees and where lives are destroyed with the flick of a wrist. Satisfied?
What's it worth to you?
If that is what you desire, then yes, I will give you something for your efforts.
Now tell me: Where did you find his body? Did my pathetic son even make it past the first steps? In the end... was he Sith?
He died right at the entrance of the tomb. Pathetic indeed.
No, he failed hard.
Of course he did! Every moment of his life existed only to mock me. I will keep his bones to remind me of my shame and to focus my anger!
But you have done me a service and such deeds should be repaid. You have brought me pain and torment. I will return the favor.
My son sought a relic I placed in the base of a cracked statue deep in the tomb. This crystal will release it. Now go.
He died valiantly, deep in the tombs. He was nearly Sith.
[Lie] He almost made it.
He died well? I suppose my son had more of me in his heart than I had ever considered possible.
With this news, you have brought me a peace I didn't think possible. Thank you. I will have him buried in honor.
Take this small token of my appreciation and go.
You're mean. [Leave]
Get out of my sight.
You don't belong on this floor.
